unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: Halloween Candy
question_text: Two large candy companies produce Halloween assortment bags which contain Cutsie Rolls as one of the candies in the bags.  A firm did a verified study sampling these candy bags from each company and counting the number of Cutsie Rolls contained.  It found that Company A had an average of $15$ Cutsie Rolls per bag while Company B had an average of $18$ Cutsie Rolls per bag.  If a $95\%$ confidence interval of the difference of these two means had a margin of error of $2.54$ , would you agree that Company B really had more Cutsie Rolls in its Halloween bags?

choices.text: No. Because zero is not contained in the confidence interval, we are confident there are not more Cutsie Rolls in the Company B bags.
No. Because zero is contained in the confidence interval, we are confident there are not more Cutsie Rolls in the Company B bags.
We cannot know because not enough information was given to us.
Yes. Because zero is not contained in the confidence interval, we are confident there are more Cutsie Rolls in the Company B bags.
Yes. Because zero is contained in the confidence interval, we are confident there are more Cutsie Rolls in the Company B bags.
